segments.text: I see the water from the sink overflowing, creating a widening puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right there, but she doesn't seem to notice it at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the sink has been like that, with water just pouring over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is streaming down the cabinet doors, making everything wet and slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the dishes stacked neatly on the counter, but they might get ruined if the water reaches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene outside the window looks so peaceful compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sorry for the woman; she's going to have a big cleanup on her hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in for a surprise when she finally looks down and sees the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing precariously on the stool, reaching for the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he manages to get down safely without falling and hurting himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl seems to be cooperating with him, not making any sudden moves.
segments.speaker: PAR
